links.title: Bug #1813663 “External monitors does not work anymore 4.15.0-44” : Bugs : linux package : Ubuntu
links.description:
I am using a docking station for my laptop. After install the 4.15.0-44 update my external monitors goes undetected after logging in or having the laptop closed.

I am on 18.04.1 LTS with Intel® HD Graphics 620 (Kaby Lake GT2) Graphics.

Going back to the 4.15.0-43 version makes it all work fine again.

A Generalised Solution to Distributed Consensus
links.description:
Distributed consensus, the ability to reach agreement in the face of failures
and asynchrony, is a fundamental primitive for constructing reliable
distributed systems from unreliable components. The Paxos algorithm is
synonymous with distributed consensus, yet it performs poorly in practice and
is famously difficult to understand. In this paper, we re-examine the
foundations of distributed consensus. We derive an abstract solution to
consensus, w...

links.title: Hello, declarative world
links.description: A computer is an imperative machine. Its CPU reads a list of instructions and performs one operation after another, with each operation modifying the state of its registers and memory. But that doesn’t mean we always have to write our computer programs as imperative step-by-step recipes; imperative programs are often too low-level and overspecified, which is why we're generally terrible at writing them.

links.title: Exotic atom - Wikipedia
links.description: An exotic atom is an otherwise normal atom in which one or more sub-atomic particles have been replaced by other particles of the same charge. For example, electrons may be replaced by other negatively charged particles such as muons (muonic atoms) or pions (pionic atoms).[1][2]  Because these substitute particles are usually unstable, exotic atoms typically have very short lifetimes.
links.original_title: Exotic Atom

links.title: Positronium - Wikipedia
links.description: Positronium (Ps) is a system consisting of an electron and its anti-particle, a positron, bound together into an exotic atom, specifically an onium.  The system is unstable: the two particles annihilate each other to predominantly produce two or three gamma-rays, depending on the relative spin states.  The orbit and energy levels of the two particles are similar to that of the hydrogen atom (which is a bound state of a proton and an electron). Ho...

links.title: Hypernucleus - Wikipedia
links.description: A hypernucleus is a nucleus which contains at least one hyperon (a baryon carrying the strangeness quantum number) in addition to the normal protons and neutrons. The first was discovered by Marian Danysz and Jerzy Pniewski in 1952 using the nuclear emulsion technique.

links.title: Illegal number - Wikipedia
links.description: An illegal number is a number that represents information which is illegal to possess, utter, propagate, or otherwise transmit in some legal jurisdiction. Any piece of digital information is representable as a number; consequently, if communicating a specific set of information is illegal in some way, then the number may be illegal as well.[1][2][3]

links.description: Elvira Nabiullina said Russia has developed its own system for financial transfers.

links.title: US cyber operation blocked internet for Russian troll farm on Election Day 2018: report
links.description: The U.S.’s main military cyber operation reportedly interfered with internet access for a major Russian troll farm on Election Day last year.

links.title: Журналистов RT не допустили на митинг за свободный интернет в Москве
links.description: Организаторы митинга за свободный интернет в Москве не допустили на демонстрацию съёмочную группу телеканала RT и видеоагентства Ruptly, объяснив это тем, что не поддерживают телеканал.

links.title: The Secrets of the Prague Astronomical Clock
links.description: Built in 1410, the Prague Astronomical clock has weathered the storm of time and war to be the oldest working astronomical clock today.

links.title: Snow blower - Wikipedia
links.description: A snow blower or snow thrower is a machine for removing snow from an area where it is not wanted, such as a driveway, sidewalk, roadway, railroad track, ice rink, or runway. The commonly-used term "snow blower" is a misnomer, as the snow is moved using an auger or impeller instead of being blown (by air). It can use either electric power (line power or battery), or a gasoline or diesel engine to throw snow to another location or into a truck to b...

links.title: De-anonymization - Wikipedia
links.description: De-anonymization is a strategy in data mining in which anonymous data is cross-referenced with other sources of data to re-identify the anonymous data source. The term became popular in 2006 when Arvind Narayanan and Vitaly Shmatikov entered a contest hosted by Netflix, and applied their de-anonymization techniques to successfully identify Netflix data for a number of specific members.[1][2][3]

links.title: What Is Ag-Gag Legislation?
links.description: Over the past few years, the farm industry has driven the introduction of "ag-gag" bills in more than half of all state legislatures across the country. These dangerous bills, pushed by the animal agriculture lobby, are designed to silence whistleblowers revealing animal abuses on industrial farms.
